text:
Hi Conor:

Thank you for reaching out. I have been working with my team to get more information and appreciate your willingness to help. A sample CTA is included below.

Our dev lead reported the following: "Bad news - that CTA link (the one at the bottom of <http://worthybonds.com/media|worthybonds.com/media>) redirects to our sign up page after passing it through to the domain <http://cta-service-cms2.HubSpot.com|cta-service-cms2.HubSpot.com>. We would need to find a way to pass a parameter to that CTA that it would then include in the redirect to worthy.capital. (recall that worthy.capital is our app and where visitors from <http://worthybonds.com|worthybonds.com> go to purchase bonds."

He continues, "After more digging I found that I can rewrite everything that's on the landing page to include the ?r={value} (this is our backend identifier that provides attribution on our systems) but I can't do that with the CTA's because HubSpot hosts those on a different domain, then includes them on the page in an iframe. This means I can't use javascript on <http://worthybonds.com|worthybonds.com> to change the link's href because it's technically on a different domain and the browser won't allow it."

His question, "If it's somehow possible for us to include our own custom javascript to use the postMessage API as described here:
 <https://www.perplexity.ai/search/using-javascript-is-KzHUCepZTR6.5R2RdsW5Lg> I think it's doable. Otherwise, we just don't have a way to modify content in an iframe where the source is on another domain, unfortunately.  Could we pose this question to their devs and see?"

I hope this provides the context that you are looking for and, again, I appreciate your assistance.
